questions.question: The focal length of a concave mirror is 20 cm. What is its radius of curvature?
questions.explanation: The radius of curvature is twice the focal length. R = 2f = 2 Ã— 20 = 40 cm

questions.question: An object is placed at the center of curvature of a concave mirror. The image formed is:
questions.explanation: When an object is placed at the center of curvature, the image is formed at the same point (center of curvature), real and inverted

questions.question: Which type of mirror is used in car headlights?
questions.explanation: Concave mirrors are used in car headlights because they can focus light rays into a parallel beam

questions.question: The mirror formula is given by:
questions.explanation: The mirror formula relates focal length (f), object distance (u), and image distance (v): 1/f = 1/u + 1/v
